dict.string:
#! /bin/sh # # Opens the selected file path in TextEdit
xargs open -e

#! /bin/sh # # Opens the selected file path or URL
xargs open
Search Apple Developer Site for Selection

#!/bin/sh
echo -n "// !!!:${USER}:" date +%Y%m%d | awk '{printf "%s", $1}' echo -n " %%%{PBXSelection}%%%" cat - echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#!/bin/sh
echo -n "// ???:${USER}:" date +%Y%m%d | awk '{printf "%s", $1}' echo -n " %%%{PBXSelection}%%%" cat - echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#!/bin/sh
echo -n "// :${USER}:" date +%Y%m%d | awk '{printf "%s", $1}' echo -n " %%%{PBXSelection}%%%" cat - echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh # # Alphabetically sorts the lines of the selection
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" sort <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh # # Alphabetically sorts the lines of the selection
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" uniq <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh # # Removes any non-printing characters from the selection # # WARNING - this does not try to be smart about encodings. If you're not using ASCII, you may be!
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" tr -cd "[:print:]\t\n\r" <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh # # Converts occurrences of opt-space to space
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" sed 's/Â / /g' <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh # # Evaluate the given mathematical expression using 'bc'
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" echo -n `( echo 'scale = 3;' ; cat ; echo ) | bc` <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh
# Convert spaces to tabs in the selected text
# use AppleScript to get the current view's tab width TABWIDTH=`osascript << ENDOFSCRIPT tell application "Xcode" set tabWidth to 4 set myFile to associated file name of front window set textDocuments to text documents repeat with i in textDocuments if path of i is myFile then set tabWidth to call method "tabWidth" of i end if end repeat tabWidth end tell ENDOFSCRIPT `
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" unexpand -t ${TABWIDTH} <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"

#! /bin/sh
# Convert tabs to spaces in the selected text
# use AppleScript to get the current view's tab width TABWIDTH=`osascript << ENDOFSCRIPT tell application "Xcode" set tabWidth to 4 set myFile to associated file name of front window set textDocuments to text documents repeat with i in textDocuments if path of i is myFile then set tabWidth to call method "tabWidth" of i end if end repeat tabWidth end tell ENDOFSCRIPT `
echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%" expand -t ${TABWIDTH} <&0 echo -n "%%%{PBXSelection}%%%"
